brief: No design brief found in generated HTML

Today felt like a day for restraint and clarity—pure typographic hierarchy with no decoration. The news is heavy (protests, deaths, constitutional crises) but not apocalyptic, so I wanted a design that feels like a well-edited newspaper: confident scale shifts, generous whitespace, and rhythm built entirely through type weight and spacing. Let the words breathe.
No design brief found in generated HTML

The strangest story today is Trump saying elections should be cancelled. That level of constitutional absurdity deserves a DEFCON aesthetic—the page is a command center terminal tracking democratic threats in real-time. Everything is green-on-black CRT terminal style with red alerts for the most dangerous stories. The design treats the news like a threat monitoring system because, well, it kind of is.
No design brief found in generated HTML

The AI child abuse story is utterly horrifying—a 26,000% increase isn't a statistic, it's a societal emergency. The page becomes a monitoring system tracking crisis levels across today's news. Everything is rendered as data readouts on a surveillance dashboard, with the AI story triggering maximum alert status. Blues and reds, clean monitoring aesthetic, pulsing indicators showing severity. The design itself becomes a warning system.
